112DD3C275F44ED6B320DE5762BEFC06.description:
SKILLS AND PROCESSES FOR GRADE 5: Alberta Education’s Information and Communication Technology (ICT) curriculum is infused throughout
the social studies program of studies. Selected ICT outcomes are suggested throughout the program and
are indicated by this symbol ->.

AB4BF71841F74513BEBBE34BA33AC0BE.description: What factors led to the creation of Nunavut? (I, CC, LPP, PADM)

6F4D2760EBD8431D844296DD1CA57E83.description:
How is the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms a symbol of Canada’s emerging
identity? (I, PADM)

FCD34C7EDCEB4C498C7FEAAE59576DCE.description:
How was the patriation of the Constitution in 1982 a step toward nationhood?
(GC, I, PADM)

68541E1B443E42A293070AC70388D33A.description: How did the adoption of the Canadian flag affect collective identity within Canada? (I, LPP)

AD4DE378AAE2401C8A3B03FB6DD56E73.description:
How did Lester B. Pearson’s initiative within the United Nations contribute to Canada’s
identity as a peacekeeping country? (GC, I, PADM)

294EEDB04F6541E5834D55FF9AF0DD61.description: How was the Statute of Westminster a recognition of Canada as a country? (C, I, TCC)

3F95D55930B749F0A76F8CB3F02729C3.description:
assess, critically, how historical events shaped collective identity in the Canadian context
by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

B65267D5B9BC48E6B3DBDCFE7CACB02A.description:
How did the economic boom immediately following the Second World War affect ways of
life in Canada? (CC, ER, TCC)

2F8EDCE5B6514812BA5121B221FF8C73.description:
In what ways did the Great Depression of the 1930s affect ways of life in urban and rural
communities? (ER, LPP, TCC)

3CD0A6E44E314792AC537D3327E33348.description:
How did the First World War contribute to the industrialization and urbanization of Canada?
(ER, LPP)

BCF193E83D304E908827BEB4EE0551CC.description:
assess, critically, how economic booms and crashes affected ways of life in Canada by
exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

B157850D6E90477A88583C00AA5A63C1.description:
How did the changes brought on by their actions affect individual rights in Canada?
(C, I, PADM)

D0EF12806F4B483EA02EE3A1334C9A6B.description: How did they identify the need for change in Canadian laws? (C, I, PADM)

75DAE8CAFFC5409ABC364BE981855DF5.description: Who were the Famous Five? (LPP, TCC)

410A8B2AED894A13B1FF0CEA238B4A29.description:
assess, critically, how the Famous Five brought about change in Canada by exploring and
reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

1390792E4B0D4A1EA146CD8BEB9B4516.description:
Why were Aboriginal peoples excluded from the negotiations surrounding Confederation?
(TCC, PADM)

9219FD0F2AA04C4EB9E7C196C7FFA266.description:
How did the building of Canada’s national railway affect the development of Canada?
(CC, ER, PADM)

A598EFA8F02D44A9B914A2CAE4A8406F.description:
How did the circumstances surrounding Confederation eventually lead to French and
English becoming Canada’s two official languages? (I, C, PADM)

27CA2E5C1AA64CE2AA28DDF266F3316E.description:
How did John A. Macdonald and George-Étienne Cartier contribute as partners of
Confederation? (TCC, PADM)

2DB1579168AF4D0ABC9A53E4947AE211.description:
assess, critically, the changes that occurred in Canada immediately following
Confederation by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

1709BEDCCB1F4C62BDF7B0AD123BC7FE.description:
recognize the historical significance of French and English as Canada’s official languages
(C, I, PADM)

05EF019823114209AAA62186497F6487.description:
recognize the effects of Confederation on citizenship and identity from multiple perspectives
(C, I, PADM, TCC)

B34F57A9FC144190B29BD4BB985A7F2F.description:
recognize how economic and political changes impact ways of life of citizens
(C, ER, I, PADM)

CCE39934E31640A3A3BBE6965B2AE37A.description: appreciate how changes impact citizenship and identity:

D0ED5A70C11146B0ABF9625CF0AB162C.description:
Canada: Shaping an Identity-General Outcome: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the events and factors that have changed the ways of life
in Canada over time and appreciate the impact of these changes on citizenship and identity.

32FB943D8ABA4503B676546E04F18435.description:
How were European immigrants affected by pressures to conform in western Canada?
(C, CC, I, GC, LPP, TCC)

006A936A06004910B6970691F5E55176.description:
What do stories of immigrants from Ukraine, Poland, Russia and Germany tell us about their
history and presence in western Canada? (CC, I, GC, LPP, TCC)

6939CA36B23C459C86834A6399B987A2.description:
examine, critically, how European immigrants shaped ways of life in western Canada by
exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

F63552842EEA498B8C5226D63BC897F2.description:
How do stories of immigrants from India contribute to an understanding of diversity in
Canada? (CC, I)

AFB2A887DDB44721B0DACA85E24931E8.description:
What do stories of the Underground Railroad tell us about the history and presence of Black
communities in Canada? (CC, I, TCC, LPP)

3F2AEF9776D349C190C6E862D4A2DC48.description:
How do stories of Chinese immigrants (i.e., railway workers) contribute to an understanding
of the development of Canada? (CC, I, TCC)

FDB807BC45AD45A6AC34F1104529D8C1.description:
examine, critically, ways of life of non-European immigrants by exploring and reflecting
upon the following questions and issues:

8E577E696D7E4903AB5735006F63E74E.description:
How have stories of the North West Mounted Police shaped identity in western and northern
Canada? (I, TCC, PADM)

706D78D60F70485893FA2EA2E1BDF0F3.description:
What do stories of the North West Mounted Police tell us about the settlement and
development of western and northern Canada? (LPP, PADM)

E0DC67DAF83B4F9B86FC7240204F6898.description:
examine, critically, how the North West Mounted Police shaped ways of life in Canada by
exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

3C53227676714C839FBA192F2F1A19D2.description:
What do stories of British peoples tell us about the British history, culture and presence in
Canada? (CC, I, TCC)

BF5BD9049F124C32A06DFF3C929801A5.description:
What do stories of Irish and Scottish immigrants tell us about their heritage and presence in
Canada? (CC, I, TCC)

2D9470F31FC344C39A980EA80838AE01.description:
examine, critically, the ways of life of immigrants from the British Isles during the Great
Migration by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

7C990E320ECE4C8585ECF8FD3533E643.description:
How did the diversity of United Empire Loyalists contribute to Canadian diversity? (I, CC,
TCC, LPP)

FFE9FF2092884B429F917A1623A70F36.description:
What do stories of the United Empire Loyalists tell us about British culture and presence in
Canada? (CC, I, TCC)

63DE4C566A3E4B09A938F3F7DB612B79.description:
examine, critically, ways of life of the United Empire Loyalists by exploring and reflecting
upon the following questions and issues:

021EE453A6084DB895230F15C4A8FB23.description:
What were the main languages spoken by fur traders and their families in the fur trade forts?
(I, CC, TCC, ER)

A82A049D471A4EFA8D38A88707155DA5.description:
How do stories about ways of life in fur trade forts reflect the British influence in Canada?
(CC, TCC, PADM)

044B875ADD3C43DB86CBA027A1CD65BD.description:
How are the stories of the Métis people, their culture and heritage rooted in the fur trade?
(CC, I, TCC)

8E2B876E970241D6AE39F30B80571016.description:
examine, critically, ways of life of the fur traders by exploring and reflecting upon the
following questions and issues:

F5F966790B0D4B49AC2449EFE1CE28CF.description:
What do stories about the habitants tell us about Francophone history, culture and presence
in Canada? (I, CC, TCC)

2709A50421D84DB5A5137988171E40BC.description:
How do stories and legends of the coureurs des bois and voyageurs inform us about
Francophone history, culture and presence throughout Canada? (I, CC, TCC)

A73410434EF943F98735E2C98407B27C.description:
examine, critically, ways of life in New France by exploring and reflecting upon the
following questions and issues:

48D33B3168A44F3DA4F58A03B0381607.description:
In what ways do anthropology and archaeology contribute to our understanding of First
Nations, Métis and Inuit peoples? (CC, LPP, TCC)

B1862C32B88F4B4381491990FEEA1DB5.description:
What was the significance of the potlatch to the identity of the Aboriginal peoples of the
Northwest Coast? (I, CC, LPP)

B5D631350A5540E189B380E0B7FE264B.description:
How were the natural environment and geography of each region of Canada determining
factors of the diversity among Aboriginal groups (e.g., languages, symbolism)? (LPP, TCC)

481A0A353D924BC29C2292E1AE5E1C14.description:
How are the Aboriginal cultures and ways of life unique in each of the western, northern,
central and eastern regions of Canada? (I, CC, TCC)

1B2FAE4FCCE4416DBAF8B1ED2E68B853.description:
What do the stories of First Nations, Métis and Inuit peoples tell us about their beliefs
regarding the relationship between people and the land? (I, CC, TCC, LPP)

E407DE75331D4010B1FEDA14CD61C95E.description:
examine, critically, the ways of life of Aboriginal peoples in Canada by exploring and
reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

0A22A3A23F3841F4B3EFE0C49EE5727F.description: recognize how changes in society can affect identity (CC, I)

7AC781020E784C67AD719CE43C9AD7FF.description:
acknowledge the contributions made by diverse cultural groups to the evolution of Canada
(CC, I, TCC)

77AF668E2646436B98C53702E37DA399.description: acknowledge British influence and presence in Canada (CC, I, TCC)

B685D93CBE5E4E5CABA07F98BDE7B8E7.description: acknowledge the roots of Francophone identity and presence in Canada (CC, I, TCC)

D5F57F6C4FED48548C72D3EC74EF892A.description:
acknowledge oral traditions, narratives and stories as valid sources of knowledge about the
land and diverse Aboriginal cultures and history (CC, I, TCC)

0D600C09CF9E415EADDC5FC23076BFC6.description:
recognize how an understanding of Canadian history and the stories of its peoples
contributes to their sense of identity (I, TCC)

E7C96C2DD18849FE99327053CE668264.description: appreciate the complexity of identity in the Canadian context:

3B34E477620A4EF8A16D23A3C2355BE1.description:
Histories and Stories of Ways of Life in Canada- General Outcome: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the people and the stories of Canada and their ways of life
over time, and appreciate the diversity of Canada’s heritage.

DE8719E39B684679A2407F486479AF87.description:
Whose responsibility should it be to ensure the preservation of Canada’s national parks and
protected areas? (C, ER, LPP)

22389901CCAB48B9A1B624C0640471CB.description: How are natural resources used, exchanged and conserved in Canada? (ER, LPP)

A56329562B734D8E8D4499FAF6B8BC86.description:
In what ways do natural resources and the physical geography of a region determine the
establishment of communities? (ER, LPP)

7281EF2C0C0443F3913639AEC732CE1C.description:
analyze how people in Canada interact with the environment by exploring and reflecting
upon the following questions and issues:

F23EB3CE917F424BA574C617518A9714.description:
How are Canada’s national parks and protected areas important to the sustainability of
Canada’s natural environment? (ER, LPP)

436B564977F54E29A2D7B33F48C50000.description:
What are the factors that determine climate in the diverse geographical regions of Canada
(e.g., latitude, water, mountains)? (LPP)

BEF5763521DA41B180DF9E2E657EFF92.description: How is the geographical region they live in different from other regions of Canada? (LPP)

A297EADCBFF840D8A9F4CD79441B9E2A.description: What are the differences and similarities among the geographical regions of Canada? (LPP)

BDE14BAA8D08410B8C65610849A63C04.description:
How have natural disasters and severe weather been part of Canada’s physical geography?
(LPP, TCC)

C8862BF619C94602A50642E0000D0827.description:
How do landforms, bodies of water and natural resources affect the quality of life in
Canada? (LPP)

E19A364021B54C91B98065D316757985.description: What are the major geographical regions, landforms and bodies of water in Canada? (LPP)

91FA7BFB3AD94BE99E7A18E3B047C753.description:
examine, critically, the physical geography of Canada by exploring and reflecting upon the
following questions and issues:

8AD26D183822471E8E3AB2A6AEE193FF.description: appreciate the geographic vastness of Canada (LPP)

E61288B3EDF64961B7AFF1614CB1E5CF.description: demonstrate care and concern for the environment through their choices and actions (GC, LPP)

94BA06EE1D9C401B8AB6887FE072E18A.description:
appreciate the influence of the natural environment on the growth and development of
Canada (LPP)

782C94BCC2B54165BCB360B9C6429216.description:
appreciate how the land sustains communities and the diverse ways that people have of
living with the land (GC, LPP)

BB507BCE04184B6587B17F5F13CF3BEC.description:
appreciate the environmental significance of national parks and protected areas in Canada
(ER, LPP)

074577E66E07458984CCCAF09EBC03E1.description: appreciate the diversity of geographic phenomena in Canada (LPP)

8905E4F493C4442EB125714BE11776FF.description: appreciate the variety and abundance of natural resources in Canada (ER, LPP)

E8DCE634DEE643658EA9633CF94683E5.description: Value Canada’s physical geography and natural environment:

DB4B852363FE4B9A971F97D6526C6106.description:
Physical Geography of Canada -General Outcome: Students will demonstrate an understanding and appreciation of how the physical geography and natural
resources of Canada affect the quality of life of all Canadians.
